page.title: 01LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: A permanent settlement has been present since Saxon times(POST A.D. 400) at Normanton.The remains of an ancient Saxon protective wall exist near the libary in Haw hill park. It is thought the name Normanton is derived from a Norwegian settlement.The word "tun" signifies on enclosure of the Northmen whilst the prefix"Norman" could be widely interpreted to mean Northmen.Altofts lies one mile North West of Normanton. The name Altofts helps support this theroy as the word "Toft" means a Scandanavian Encolsure. The river Calder meanders North then Eastwards along its flood plain whilst Normanton is situated South and East of the river which was called the Keldre (rapid water)in 1052. Normontunne is mentioned in the Domesday book of 1086.
